text: The interesting thing about this place is that it is very cozy. I was here last night with a couple of friends and the place is dimly lit and it just looks overall very warm and chill. We got in and ordered our drinks, which by the way was a good deal - $10 for two pints. Now here's the interesting part: inside, there's a faux furnace with varying sizes of candles in it. There are mini candles on the tables everywhere and I was like "Oh cool. Mildly Gothic." And then all of the sudden Frank Ocean's "Super Rich Kids" is blasting on the speakers. And then a few more tracks from Channel Orange. And then some more contemporary Hiphop music. I gotta say, I loved the contradiction. It's a Friday night, they have  full bar with a few of my favorite drinks in it, all the bartenders are girls (coincidence?) and they are looking extra fine. We paid ~$32 including tip - 5 pints of beer, and a glass of... Coke. I know, we had a 22-year old PhD kid with us who hates beer and sushi. Cheers!

Things I like:  Basement bars, 90's hip-hop, and the un-tied Timberland boot renaissance. Mix that up with a decent charcuterie platter, freshly spun cocktails, a balancing bar staff - and it ain't nothing but a gangsta party. Picture perfect.

On a seulement pris un dernier verre sur la terrasse, on était super bien installés. L'alcool était assez cher... 12$ pour un verre de gin tonic, ouch. La serveuse était gentille, le bar a l'intérieur était vide et il n'y avait pas de musique. Je n'ai rien à rajouter, c'était somme toute une expérience plus qu'ordinaire.

Je me suis rendue au bar En Cachette sans trop d'attentes puisque je n'avais jamais entendu parler de cet endroit avant. Le bar est plutôt petit en plus d'être dans un sous-sol, mais c'est assez beau et propre. On y trouve quelques tables et fauteuils. En entrant, la chaleur intense m'a frappée. Il faisait TELLEMENT chaud, impossible de respirer! Vu la taille du bar, c'était encore pire! Après avoir demandé à une employée s'il était possible de fermer le chauffage, la température s'est beaucoup améliorée.   Pour le service maintenant.... Aucun sourire de la part des serveuses. Elles avaient toutes l'air complètement dépassées par les événements et étaient à la limite impolies! Le bar était assez rempli alors le service était plutôt long, d'autant plus que nous étions assis à une table dans le fond. Mes amis et moi avons également trouvé les prix assez élevés...Si je paie 8 $ pour un gin tonic qui contient à peine l'alcool, j'ai l'habitude de terminer mon verre...Eh bien à deux reprises la serveuse a repris mon verre, qui n'était pas terminé du tout, en venant ramasser ce qui se trouvait sur notre table. Quand je dis " pas terminé ", je veux dire bu à moitié! Vraiment fâchant... Après, chaque fois qu'elle s'approchait de notre table il fallait la surveiller pour qu'elle ne reparte pas avec nos verres à moitié pleins!   Malgré tout, j'ai bien aimé ma soirée puisque je me trouvais en bonne compagnie et que le DJ invité était vraiment génial!

There was nobody in this joint when we got there which kinda threw us off but we were looking for a low key place to just chill anyway so seemed perfect.   We had already went out to eat before and just wanted a little something to nibble on so got the calamari, which were really good. Not too chewy, light batter. They have a pretty good drink menu and the music is nice and relaxing. Definitely a chill vibe going on. The waitress didn`t seem too happy to be there though at first. She was kind of dragging her feet. She seemed alright as time progressed.  When we called for the cheque, this is where it went downhill. Another waitress came to bring it to us and totally mixed all our drinks together. It was only 2 bills, not sure how it can get so messed up. The 2nd time around, they still got it wrong. It seemed to take forever to correct it. She just ended up not charging me for one of my drinks.   How can a place so relaxing end up being so stressful in the end!!

Découvert cet endroit grâce a un ami. Je connaissais l'établissement à l'époque ou il s'agissait d'un café sous le nom de Croissant de Lune. On y prenait de délicieuses crêpes. A présent, l'endroit a gardé le même cachet avec ses tables en bois, son côté intime, mais s'est transformé en bar branché. A l'extérieur la terrasse est superbe, elle se trouve sur la rue St-Denis, mais est toute discrète donc parfaite pour un rendez-vous. On dispose sur les tables des bougies rendant l'ambiance encore plus agréable. Belle liste de cocktails, vins, bières et forts. On a assez de choix pour tous les goûts. Prix raisonnable pour le quartier. Et j'ai trouvé le service impeccable. La serveuse était chaleureuse est revenue nous voir à quelques reprises pour voir si tout allait bien, mais en prenant bien soin de ne pas déranger notre rendez-vous! Je reviendrais définitivement :) Aussi musique des années 90 si je ne me trompe pas, l'ambiance était sympa, pas mal bruyant mais de la terrasse on est pas du tout dérangé!

It was a great experience. I took a date there early evening on a Saturday. It wasn't full. It was a nice contrast of tavern style atmosphere and hop-hop and R&B music. Nice drink options and food was good. Later on it got packed, music got louder and there was dancing! Loved it!
It's a nice lounge bar and it's getting little bit more loud after 22:00. The food and drinks are good, nice atmosphere. Great place to meet up with few friends or for an after dinner date drinks.

The music here was excellent, the vibe was really cool and best of all it was not very busy. This was my first time here, and all I really had was a few pints and a couple unexpected shots. It was a great night, definitely a place that I will be going back to.

J'y suis allée avec une amie samedi soir. On est arrivé vers 23h, il n'y avait pas grand monde. J'ai commandé un verre, il était pas génial et plutôt cher (12$). La musique était pas terrible non plus, personne dansait mais le DJ lui il adorait sa musique, il se déhanchait sur sa chaise lol. Bref je suis repartie à 1h30. Soirée vite terminée.

I feel like I need to write two different reviews of this place because the quite lounge you encounter around 7pm is nothing like the club that you'll be waiting in line to get in after the DJ arrives at 11pm.  Reading some great reviews on here (thanks fellow yelpers), my friend and I decided to check out the Hideaway.  Sleeman's white and red were on special, 2 pints for $10, which was a great deal.  We enjoyed the quiet, low-key atmosphere and chatted with the bartender for a while.  My friend ordered and enjoyed the crab cakes and we learned that the entire menu is homemade by the owner's mother.  How can you go wrong with that?    While we were there, I noted the quite jazz and said "this isn't 90s hip hop, but it's still really nice," and then learned that the place is very different (read: packed wall-to-wall) once the DJ gets pumping at 11.  We returned shortly after midnight and had to wait a few minutes to get in.  The music was pumping and the party was loud.  By then the beer was up to $7, though shots were still at $5.  If you're a real hearty partier, though, bottle service is available, because who doesn't buy a bottle of Jameson when they go out?  Fortunately, my friend and I were down with both vibes, but if you don't like lots of people and loud music, come early, and if you like a hopping place, come by a little later.  Either way, stop by, tip your bartender, and enjoy a nice time in a beautiful, American prohibition-style speakeasy.
